title: Kuzan is a Double Agent for SWORD
theoryText: Kuzan's statement about not trusting the World Government and his mysterious activities mentioned by Doflamingo suggest he may be working as a double agent. The theory proposes that Kuzan is actually a member of SWORD (the secret Marine special forces) and is infiltrating the Blackbeard Pirates to gather intelligence or work towards a currently unknown goal. His conversation with Smoker in this episode hints at his continued commitment to justice, just through unconventional means.
author: One Piece Community/Reddit

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains theories about Kuzan's future alliance with Blackbeard and SWORD

title: Kuzan's Journey to Laugh Tale Theory
theoryText: Following Kuzan's statement about making a difference outside the Marines and Doflamingo's mention of rumors, some fans theorize that Kuzan is simply trying to reach Laugh Tale by aligning himself with Blackbeard. This theory suggests that Kuzan believes Blackbeard has the highest chance of reaching Laugh Tale and discovering the truth about the world, which aligns with his distrust of the World Government revealed in this episode.
author: One Piece Community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains theories about Kuzan's future activities and Laugh Tale

title: The Titanic Commanders Symbolism Theory
theoryText: Based on Kuzan's ice powers demonstrated in this episode and his later association with the Blackbeard Pirates, fans have theorized about symbolic foreshadowing. The ten captains of the Blackbeard Pirates are called 'Titanic Commanders,' and since Kuzan has the Hie Hie no Mi (Ice-Ice Fruit), the theory suggests he will eventually 'sink' all the Titanic commanders with his ice abilities - a reference to the sinking of the Titanic ship in 1912. This theory connects to the philosophical stance Kuzan reveals in this episode about working outside traditional structures.
author: u/Kind-Slice144

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains theories about Kuzan's role in the Blackbeard Pirates and future betrayal

title: Kuzan Targeting Imu Theory
theoryText: When Doflamingo questions Kuzan about rumors in this episode, a reflection can be seen in Doflamingo's sunglasses. Some fans believe this reflection contains a figure that looks like Imu. Combined with Kuzan's statement about not trusting the World Government, the theory proposes that Kuzan's true target is Imu, the secret ruler of the World Government. This theory suggests Kuzan is gathering power and allies to eventually challenge the highest authority in the world.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains theories about Imu and Kuzan's ultimate goals

title: Shusui's Return to Wano Foreshadowing
theoryText: Kin'emon's confrontation with Zoro about Shusui in this episode is theorized to be foreshadowing for Zoro eventually returning the sword to Wano Country. Fans predict that Zoro will honor the cultural significance of Shusui that Kin'emon explains and will return it to Wano in exchange for another legendary blade, possibly Enma. This theory suggests that this seemingly minor conflict in episode 625 sets up a major character moment for Zoro later in the series.
author: One Piece Community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains predictions about Zoro's sword trades in the Wano Arc
